com.bfo.json

Class JWT

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bfo.json.JWT

  • public class JWT
extends Object
    A trivial Java Web Token class. Supports all standard JWT algorithms.

    Examples

     JWT jwt = new JWT(Json.parse("{....}"));
 jwt.sign(key, "HS256");           // Sign using a symmetric key
 jwt = new JWT(jwt.toString());    // Encode then decode
 assert jwt.verify(key, null);    // Verify using the same symmetric key

 byte[] pubkey = ...
 byte[] prikey = ...
 jwt.getHeader().put("x5u", ...);       // Add custom content to header
 jwt.sign(prikey, "ES256");             // Sign using a asymmetric key
 assert jwt.verify(pubkey, "ES256");   // Verify using corresponding key

 jwt.getPayload().clear();              // Modify the payload
 assert !jwt.verify(pubkey, "ES256");  // Signature is no longer valid

 System.out.println(jwt.getPayload());
 System.out.println(jwt.getAlgorithm());

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Create a new JWT with no payload and the "none" algorithm.

      • JWT

      • JWT

        public JWT(Json payload)
        Create a new JWT with the specified payload and the "none" algorithm.
        Parameters:
        payload - the payload object to embed in the JWT

        Parameters:

        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return the encoded JWT
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] key,
                      String alg)
        Verify the JWT.
        Parameters:
        key - the key. Either an HMAC key or a DER or PEM encoded public key for signature types. Required unless the algorithm is "none".
        alg - the algorithm name. If null it will default to getAlgorithm().
        Returns:
        true if the JWT is verified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a GeneralSecurityException if there are cryptographic problems when verifying.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(PublicKey key,
                      String alg,
                      Provider provider)
        Verify the JWT.
        Parameters:
        key - the key. Required unless the algorithm is "none".
        alg - the algorithm name. Optional, if it's null it will use getAlgorithm().
        provider - the Provider to use for Signature verification, or null to use the default.
        Returns:
        true if the JWT is verified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a GeneralSecurityException if there are cryptographic problems when verifying.

      • sign

        public void sign(byte[] key,
                 String alg)
        Sign the JWT. Sets the "alg" key in the header and updates the signature.
        Parameters:
        key - the key. Either an HMAC key or a DER or PEM encoded private key for signature types. Required unless the algorithm is "none".
        alg - the algorithm name. Required.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a GeneralSecurityException if there are cryptographic problems when signing.

      • sign

        public void sign(PrivateKey key,
                 String alg,
                 Provider provider)
        Sign the JWT. Sets the "alg" key in the header and updates the signature.
        Parameters:
        key - the key. Required unless the algorithm is "none".
        alg - the algorithm name. Required.
        provider - the Provider to use for Signature creation, or null to use the default.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a GeneralSecurityException if there are cryptographic problems when signing.

      • getAlgorithm

        public String getAlgorithm()
        Return the algorithm name.
        Returns:
        the algorithm name

      • getPayload

        public Json getPayload()
        Return the payload object. The sign(byte[], java.lang.String) method should be called after any modifications to the returned object to update the signature.
        Returns:
        the payload object

      • getHeader

        public Json getHeader()
        Return the header object. The sign(byte[], java.lang.String) method should be called after any modifications to the returned object to update the signature.
        Returns:
        the header object

      • getSignature

        public byte[] getSignature()
        Return the signature object. Any modifications to the returned object will invalidate the signature.
        Returns:
        the signature bytes, which will be zero-length if the algorithm is "none"
